summary: A "bio-based product" refers to materials derived from renewable biological resources, including plant and animal materials. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, bio-based products are significant for promoting sustainability and reducing reliance on fossil fuels. The European Union has established various directives and regulations to encourage the development and market uptake of bio-based products, aligning with its broader environmental and circular economy goals. This concept is integral to policies aimed at fostering innovation in technology and technical regulations, thereby supporting the transition towards a more sustainable economy. The term "biobased product" serves as a redirect to the preferred term "bio-based product."
